Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Love it
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 16 November 2020
Review - Body: So a bit of history about me that led me to buying this.  I have had pretty much every iphone since they first appeared.  The 4/4s and 5 remain my favourite.  The mIni shares many design cues with those which was part of th eappeal.However the real appeal was that I wanted a small, light premium phone after lugging my iphone 11 around since it came out.So I took the plunge and decided to get the 12 mini despite it being a drastic drop in screen size and on arrival I wonder if I had done the right thing.The phone comes in the usual premium Apple packaging minus a charger which is fine.  I went for the white one, and its more off white but stunning.Immediately it felt at home in my hand.  Setup is mega easy, I just turned it on next to my 11 and about half hour later all my apps, photos and settings were transferred.  Some additional setup was needed for banking apps and signing into Apple Pay but thats fine and expected.Its light and the design is spot on.  I started to have a play and contrast against my 11 and initially i felt it was the wrong choice but now the 11 feels completely alien to me.The OLED screen is lovely and the difference by comparison to my 11 is amazing.  A few videos latter and the screen has won me over.The key point for me is using it one handed is a joy again.  Moving about the gym with it is a joy again, generally living with it so far has been joyful.The camera is superb and in particular low light pictures are a win.Battery life, it has a small battery.  As an 'average' user I get through the day fine.  At a push I could get almost 2 days out of my 11, this wont do that but gets me through my average day.  When I'm int he car using carplay the phone is charging, in fact most places I have access to charge if need be.The build quality is fantastic.  Every bit the premium phone and this time I went for white which I am loving.I have encountered one issue that has been reported on by the tech press, and that is if you fit a screen protector and a case, there is an intermittent issue where the screen doesnt respond to a swipe.  I notice that maybe one in ten swipes to unlock requires me to reswipe.  Hoping Apple resolve this with a software fix and that it is not hardware.  Though Apple I know are better than most offering support programs to fix any problems.Overall, the camera, screen and build are amazing and this is the perfect phone for me against a trend of making phones bigger and bigger.  There are compromises such as average battery and the aforementioned problem.  Theres even 5g support when that becomes available.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great replacement for my old 5s
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 June 2022
Review - Body: After my 5s it took some time to adjust and I miss the thumb recognition, especially as covid hit and masks became necessary. The mask face recognition is hit and miss. When using apple pay in stores this can be an inconvenience.The battery is far superior to my 5s, but is still lacking when in heavy use.I also miss the audio jack, I've had this phone 4 months now and really need to find some wireless headphones. I rarely use headphones so cheap £5 plug-in's were so much more convenient to me, than having something extra to keep charged up.But overall I love this phone, it's fast, faster than my laptop in processing speeds. It's the perfect size as I need a  phone, not a small tablet in my pocket.The screen and camera are great, the photos are as good as any camera I've had. And it's a pleasure to watch movies on.It has a rating of IP68 under IEC standard 60529 (maximum depth of 6 metres up to 30 minutes)My phone did get wet once (dropped while reading in the bath) and I went to charge it later and a warning came up telling me to let it dry. I've had zero issues since, so I'm very impressed by this.**********Edit after nearly a year of ownership.My new phone accidentally found its way in the washing machine. I thankfully realised quickly and got it out within 5 minutes and after drying out it works as well as it ever has. Amazing. I thought it was a goner.Also the mask/face recognition issue has been greatly improved with updates.I still occasionally miss the audio jack, but it’s not worth losing a star over so I’m upgrading my rating to 5*.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Going from a 10R to a 12 mini.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 December 2020
Review - Body: Coming from a 10R to a 12 mini.The 10R was one of the best iPhones I’ve ever had, it was the first time I was introduced to the edge to edge display and the game changing Face ID and the best battery iv ever had in an iPhone, there technically wasn’t anything wrong with my 10R but my dad has an iPhone 4 and is not one to go out and buy himself a new phone but wait till one of us hands him down one of our old ones and when I saw the 12 mini it intrigued me! So I decided to go for it and get one (and I’ll give my dad my old 10R.... good son or what!) tho there was a couple of things I was worried about, one: how would I feel going from a bigger phone to a smaller one and two: going from the best battery in an iPhone to one not so grate, well iv had this phone for a week now and.... I love it! The size is not a major difference really, only by an inch or two I think, but the small iPhone 5 like body with the iPhone 10 display is brilliant and just looks and feels like an iPhone should, I thought with going with a smaller display I would need to increase the text size for my ageing eyes but i found this isn’t necessary and the small body with the iPhone 5 flat edges rather than curved ones we’ve had since iPhone 6 feels grate in the hand and I’m able to do something iv not done in a while... use my phone with the one hand! The next thing was battery, iv actually watched a battery drain test video on YouTube and was surprised to see the 12 mini died the same time as the 10R and all week iv been paranoidly checking my battery health to see how fast it’s going down and I’m finding that it’s lasting just as long as my 10R did ending the day with just over half the battery left (this is with my own general use, not a heavy user and don’t play games) so I was really chuffed about that!All in all this is a grate phone and I’d say my best iPhone yet and I’m glad I went for it.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Upgrade from iPhone 8 - haven’t looked back
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 November 2021
Review - Body: I bought my last iPhone (iPhone 8) back not long after it was released so I was definitely due an upgrade. I purchased the 12 mini when it was on offer during Prime Day - and I’m so glad I did. I’d forgotten what it’s like to have a phone that actually lasts all day - the 8 required mid-day charges quite quickly after I bought it so I had chargers dotted all around my life for convenience. I think I’ve only had to use them with the 12 mini a couple of times in the months I’ve had it.Other plus points - it’s fast, 128gb storage means I no longer have to offload apps to save space, and the size is absolutely perfect - it fits in my jeans front pocket easily (the “normal” 12 is too big for your pocket to be comfortable. I’m a huge advocate that if I want a big screen I’ll use my iPad - my iPhone is for convenience, messaging and calls.The camera is brilliant - has lifted my photos to a whole new level. I must admit though, I don’t rate the wide angle lens much - it creates a bit of a fish-eye distort to pictures which I’m not a fan of. The decent front facing camera is great for selfies though. And I really love portrait mode how it blurs the background behind the subject.This is my first phone with FaceID. Mixed opinion - in many ways it’s nice and convenient - when it works. But if for some reason it’s having a moment and doesn’t recognise your face, it’s a pain. I’d say I have more difficulty opening my phone with faceid than I have ever had with TouchID. Given the choice I’d go back to touch. And when wearing a face mask it’s a pain!All in all, I’m very happy with my new phone and I’m expecting it to last many years.

Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent small iPhone
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 November 2020
Review - Body: Review UPDATED December 2020.Been using the device for almost 4 weeks now and thought the review needed an update.The device is really nice to hold in the hand. Very compact and well built. I have been after a good small phone and this has been excellent. Beautiful display clarity and brightness. Notch is still there but if you buy one of these iPhones then I am assuming you are ok with it.Overall performance is excellent and I decided to keep the device. I also had the pixel 4a which is another excellent small phone. Very comparable in a lot of ways but obviously huge price difference. If you are after a high end, compact smartphone then you should be happy with the mini.I’ve had 5G off since day one. It is not really available in most places as of right now and drains battery quicker. My brightness is set to auto. Dark mode set to auto turn on and off with dusk and dawn. With all the above in mind, the small battery has been excellent. No exaggeration at all. Battery life is fantastic. I am as surprised as anyone! There are days I get easily over 6 hours screen on time and more. I have Bluetooth on all times and connected to my galaxy watch. WiFi on pretty much all day as I work from home. Have not had any issues with battery, which was my main worry before buying the mini.Now please keep in mind that I am not a gamer on my phone. I do not play high end games. My battery life has been based on normal usage. Phone calls, emails, web browsing, some streaming services, music and using the camera. Just normal day to day stuff. Very pleasantly surprised. Comfortably making a full day and then some.Excellent small phone and I would highly recommend.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Surprisingly Good
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 May 2022
Review - Body: I have used this as a daily phone for a number of days now and so far the battery has been fine. Some reviews did make me worry. Recently had the battery replaced on my GF's old iPhone for £55 so even if this modest battery does conk out after a couple of years (if some of these reviews are to be taken seriously) then i think I can cope with the low expense of a replacement. I use the phone for calls, texts on various apps, and pretty heavy use of Discord and its been great. Despite it's small size I haven't had too much trouble texting but admittedly it is currently more difficult than my older huge 6.5 inch screen zenfone. I will get used to the size and I will get used to using ioS and then will be able to use the phone as proficiently as an android.The only bad thing is colours look bland but that is half because of the fact I tend to over saturate my phones and tv pictures because I like a colourful screen. The screen can be made 'warmer' however but it certainly isn't as adjustable as an android. There may be apps available that can help but like I say am new to ios.The product red colour really pops.Face recognition makes life so easy too. I prefer it to finger print ( a function this iphone does not have) .

Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Good phone
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 18 January 2022
Review - Body: I said I’d never ever spend anywhere near £600 for a phone but I found this and thought I haven’t had a brand new phone for years and if I can afford it then why not. I’ve also never had one with so much storage so I found myself downloading apps and games that I probably won’t use. I’ve had rose gold/pink phones for years now so thought I’d come away from that as I liked the purple. I also decided to pay it off in the 5 monthly instalments to make it even easier.It arrived quickly and I was eager to get it set up..However.. it doesn’t come with a plug.. so I then had to go out to my nearest supermarket and spend even more money on a charging plug so I could actually turn it on. I  upgraded from a 6s so I couldn’t even use that one. For the amount of money you spend Apple should still at least give you the full charging accessory.After setting it up I had a little play around as it’s got some extra things I hadn’t had before. Sound is decent, screen size is good, overall phone size is good. Face recognition works well..It’s overall a pretty good phone with the bonus of the nice colour instead of plain white or black.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    The best small iPhone to date!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 July 2021
Review - Body: Apple iPhone 12 mini 128gb £599 from Amazon Prime. A great deal to good to pass up. Was considering the iPhone SE 64gb £399 or £449 for the 128gb, but when I saw this mini at a reduced  price it made more sense now. Original price for iPhone 12 mini 64gb at £699 which is £300 more than the SE version so the question is, is the mini 12 worth £300 more than the SE? NO! Is it worth £150 more? That’s an astounding YES! So go and treat yourself to the best small iPhone from Amazon prime.Review update: Started watching The Walking Dead season 9 and thought I’ll test the iPhone mini 12 battery life. So after fully charged 100% I continued watching using the Prime app from season 9, episode 6, 54min  episode 7, 43min  episode 8, 44min  episode 9, 51min  episode 10, 45min  episode 11, 41min  episode 12, 44min  episode 13, 40min  episode 14, 45min  episode 15, 57min  episode 16, 46minIn between episodes Amazon throws in around 30sec ads for other TV series. The iPhone mini 12 still had 15% ( red ) and I recharged using the official Apple 20w usb-c charger, and it took a little over 2hrs to fully charge to 100%. Honestly I don’t see any issues with battery life. It’s a small phone so naturally comes with a small battery, but after this showing I’m impressed.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Sleek fast and you don’t need a backpack to carry it around
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 May 2021
Review - Body: Great phone, I wanted a phone I could comfortably use that wasn’t as massive as the other phones on the market today. I’m a swipe to text guy so the 12 mini is perfect as it’s easy to text one handed. The screen is great, bright and crisp and is super responsive. Forget the reviews who say it’s only 60hz refresh rate. There’s nothing you will be doing on your phone that’s over 60hz, it’s a phone not a gaming pc so it handles everything perfectly.I was concerned about the potential battery life before I bought the phone but I can honestly say it’s never died on me. My average phone screen time is about 3 hours day so I end up charging it every day and a half to 2 days. I bought an apple plug so I could fast charge and it charges nice and fast ( not as fast as my previous one plus 5t ).The main reason I bought the iPhone 12 mini instead of a new Samsung or even the latest oneplus offering was, the Samsung is absolutely massive. The oneplus ( albeit cheaper and good bang for buck ) just couldn’t compare to the camera quality and overall user experience.People ask me how I can watch movies and videos on a screen that’s this size and my honest answer is: I have 4K TVs for a reason. My phone is used as a phone and camera, some email and web browsing and small amounts of media consumption here and there, Netflix or YouTube binges are reserved for the tv

Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    It's a one-handed iPhone
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 25 July 2021
Review - Body: The iPhone 12 Mini’s build quality, speed and task handling are the same to my untrained eye as the Max’s. Indeed, the oddest observation I can make is the zero difference I have experienced reading, texting and photo editing compared to the larger iPhone.Reading social media feeds is no different at all. Text on the iPhone 12 Mini doesn’t seem smaller in day to day use. Perhaps it might do in a side-by-side comparison.Using the iPhone 12 Mini is a joy. It is bliss when leaving home with a phone that slips into a pocket and stays unnoticed.The Mini is light even when compared to my wife’s iPhone 11 Pro. I can’t believe how much heavier my wife’s Pro phone feels.So far, so good.The iPhone 12 Mini works with MagSafe accessories and is capable of fast charging, so at least I haven’t wasted the expense of those items (Apple MagSafe Wallet and Charger).Unlike the iPhone 12 Pro Max, the Mini is comfortable to hold, easier to type on and works.But, there’s always a but.There are only two issues that weaken my long-term commitment to the concept of an iPhone Mini-sized phone:No telephoto lens - I miss some photo opportunities.A weaker battery - Always start the day on a full charge to avoid getting caught out.I don't regret buying the Mini, especially when Amazon cut the price by £100. But in an ideal world, I'd prefer an iPhone Mini Pro.

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 January 2023
Review - Body: These speakers are great quality. I use this in the kitchen/diner for music when cooking, cleaning and having guests over. Its never too quiet, the sound can fill the whole room with good quality and have more to give.There is integration to Amazon Alexa and to Goggle Assistant. I found the Google integration was completely useless and did not work at all, that was my preferred option so had to go with Alexa in the end. This is actually pretty good and kind of works like spotify. Essentially a free streaming service for music with ads unless you buy premium. I dont tend to use it but did give it a go and liked all the curated playlists and radio stations they have made.

Product Title: Sonos One (Gen2) The powerful smart speaker with built in voice control (Black)
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    I got one... two... then three...
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 June 2020
Review - Body: I started with just one of these speakers. First thoughts its easy to set up. App is reliable, makes it super easy to play music.I then brought a second to create a stereo pair... that was the WOW factor. It completely changes the listening experience. The audio sounds so much richer. I was shocked on how much it changed the music I was playing and now there's two we havent actually gone above 50% volume 🤭 because its so loud.We was so impressed we brought a third for the bedroom. Now I can play music everywhere while I'm wondering around and doing the house work!My issues with these speakers... all three of them in fact.ALEXA just seems to have bugs on Sonos.1st. If your broadband drops, well Alexa will refuse to reconnect, she just constantly says something along the lines "i'm struggling to connect at the moment, please check your Internet connection". The weird thing is the Sonos side works fine and reconnects fine after a drop. E.g. I can play music via the app. You are forced to restart all the speaker everytime the internet drops to rekick in the Alexa integration.2nd. Some features are limited compared to Amazons own devices. E.g. Alexa cant phone people. You can't connect any multirooms with Amazons own alexa devices.3rd. Alexa just randomly does not play music when you ask her to. "Alexa, play music from Harry's Spotify account" and then she just stops... Check the Alexa app... and she heard me perfectly and understood (you can see your speech against text on how alexa understood what you asked).Although we have now got to a point where we just don't use Alexa, which isn't a big deal for us but might be for others. All said, Generally Sonos is a fantastic eco system and Sonos Ones don't fall short from what you should expect from the brand.

Product Title: Sonos One (Gen2) The powerful smart speaker with built in voice control (Black)
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Fantastic little speaker, allows use of Alexa without need for Echo or Dot devices.
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 6 January 2020
Review - Body: Having taken the plunge to install some smart lights and sockets, when I read about this product it appeared that the Alexa voice component was for use with audio features however it also allows us to use voice control of anything that "she" is linked to. Once we had added the Sonos skill to Alexa we did not need the Echo in our kitchen any longer and were able to re-purpose it in another room.The unit itself is very smart, small, satin black plastic in appearance with the metal grill around the middle outer surface. The sound from such a small device is however very clear, crisp and has a surprisingly rich bass to it for the size. At higher volumes it is not as good as the larger Play5 unit but common sense dictates that at the end of the day.Touch controls on the top surface are very easy to use, regardless of how dry, damp or greasy your fingers may be but it would be advisable to only use dry and clean hands to prevent muck being deposited into the ring of very small holes that constitute aperture for the microphone array.When using voice control the speaker can be trained with the Alexa app to better understand a particular user's voice however the generic "out the box" settings work perfectly for all my family as none of us have strong regional dialects. I cannot speak for anyone from Newcastle or Glasgow but when I was reading the reviews on this unit on some hifi websites they did state that for such accents the training would be beneficial so that it does not keep moaning about not understanding voice commands. Just be aware that if you put the unit in a corner and run it at anything about about 6/10 on the volume scale then it is likely it will not respond to voice at all as the system will be making so much noise that it may not accurately hear your commands.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    If you're swapping from Android and have never had an iPhone, this is the best one for you!
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 15 July 2022
Review - Body: So, I had just brought this phone a good two months ago and I have never been so pleased with a phone before. I had come from a Samsung S10e and if any of you knew that phone, you would know it is a small and very compact phone. My battery life on the Samsung was really bad, so I had decided to get an iPhone 11. Happy to say that I don't regret buying it.I had got the initial phone for £480 ish as I brought the 128gb version, since I needed the storage. I have barely used half of the storage too, which is good. The battery is actually good, it goes down gradually as the hours pass, but sometimes I notice that if I keep certain apps like Spotify opened up for a long time, the battery tends to go down faster, but that's probably because I have Spotify on 24/7. However, on a normal day, the battery basically lasts for most of the day.I had a hard time trying to adjust to the new phone and its' new functions, but I had quickly gotten used to it as I used it more and more. Obviously this is common knowledge but I don't like that Apple had gotten rid of the earphone jack. That annoyed me. But the sound is amazing on this phone.The camera is pretty decent too, it feels like I have a professional camera in my phone. The camera has many functions to suit different people's needs when it comes to having a camera in their phone. I have taken some really nice shots with my phone, and my friends could not believe that it came from my iPhone.Not going to lie, I used to be a Samsung fanboy, so I would always put Apple down for their phones and say that Samsung was better. However, that is now the contrary. I am absolutely pleased with the phone, and I know everyone hypes up iPhones, and yeah, to an extent, it shouldn't be hyped up that much, but, in my experience, this is a rock solid phone and I recommend buying it if you can't afford the more newer phones, as it essentially has all of the functions the newer phones have. Additionally, the iPhone 11 will be updated for more years, so that's even more of a reason to buy this phone.

Review - Title:
2.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Bought as Excellent but Battery Health 78% Returned
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 19 December 2022
Review - Body: Ordered for a Christmas present, read through the Amazon renew guarantee of all items inspected and graded and all grades have a battery capacity of greater than 80% so I ordered the excellent condition 64GB version and the seller was Plunc Tech, I even read the reviews on the seller and nothing was sticking out from the feedback.Item arrived in plain packaging with a charger and charging lead and sim tool, it was well packaged, took the phone out screen had a crusty blob of what looked like food, but came off, no dents or scratches on the casing and only a few hairline scratches on the screen, charged it up, set it up and went to battery health and was gutted to see the batter capacity was only 78% to say I was peed off is an understatement.Contacted Amazon and they were very apologetic and asked if I wanted to contact the seller first, I agreed and the seller said all the usual about how all phones are checked and fully refurbished before being sent out, however this wasn’t my experience. They sent me a Royal Mail return label just as they was going on strike so posted on Tuesday and wasn’t delivered until the Monday, I was hoping for a replacement or at least a new battery, and when I contacted them today asking for the options, the reply was we’ve refunded you, now the earliest I can get a replacement is Christmas Eve I would have rather had this phone’s battery replaced even if it didn’t arrive in time for Christmas so I new that I’d have a nice phone with great battery.Now I’ve reordered from a different company and im now playing Russian roulette hoping the battery is decent and not a duff, Apple considers batteries of less than 80% as needing replacement.The Amazon renewed guarantee is great though and customer service are really helpful and explained that anything your not happy with within 12 months you can return or replace, it was just unfortunate that this happened at Christmas timeUpdate: Second iphone arrived this time only 81% battery, as this is supposed to be a phone in excellent condition I’m not that happy as this battery will need replacing within a year, so another returned iPhone, im not being picky I just want something that will last at least 12 months without any issues and the battery is the main issue, phones described as excellent, good or acceptable should be based on the health of the battery, if I ordered a phone in an acceptable condition then I’d be ok with this, but paying a premium for excellent condition, this just isn’t good enough

     I purchased this iPhone 14 Starlight at a good price, and I am delighted! It is at really good aesthetic condition, the screen is like brand new. It takes really good videos and pictures. It presents a minor tiny scratch on the metal lateral part, but I didn't really notice because I kept the phone case cover on top. Absolute satisfied with this product.I really appreciated the packaging even if it was not from the original apple packaging. The delivery was super fast, from the purchase it took only 3 days. I am very satisfied and I hope this review can help the seller to improve their revenues. 😀👍

Review - Body: I was a bit nervous about buying a reconditioned iPhone 14, but I’m really pleased. This is so much better than my ancient iPhone 6. Great product, price, seller and service.

Review - Body: iPhone works perfectly and is in excellent condition - however does not come with a genuine apple charger and the charger does not work. Requested a replacement charger for the phone. 2nd message sent to the seller with no response

Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 22 October 2023
Review - Body: The condition was described as very good and there are no noticeable scratches or marks, only ever so faint ones on the screen, so super happy about that. Such good value for money I was looking for a second hand iPhone 13 in good condition and this was one of the cheapest I found. I ordered it late Friday night and it was supposed to be delivered on Tuesday however it arrived early Sunday morning.

Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Great Apple iPhone 13
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 July 2023
Review - Body: I Love this mobile phone, it works as new, the picture quality is amazing, the battery percentage is 88% I guess that's quite good, 100% would off been better, but the phone functions really well and holds a good charge for some time. Apple iPhone 13 is so easy to use with a lot of protection from Apple them selves. So I'm very happy with this phone. Also comes with a 12 months Amazon warranty.

I could have paid less and got a phone in average condition! Have to keep it as I need a phone but won’t make the same mistake in the future.

Product Title: CASEKOO Armor Shockproof for iPhone 15 Case [10FT Military Grade Protection] Matte Finish Protective Phone Case Anti-Fingerprint Non-Slip Thin Slim Hard Cover for iPhone 15 - Blue
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very nice case, well worth the money
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 20 October 2023
Review - Body: So I discovered Casekoo on YouTube, started using a black translucent one on my iPhone 14 pro max, after trying 3 other brands(spigen was one of them), sent them all back for various reasons, then got the Casekoo case and I liked it so much I kept it on the phone for 6months until I upgraded to my 15 pro max, I had to have another for my new phone, so I went with the blue one to match my blue 15 pro max, it really does compliment the phone well.What I like most about the case is the fact that it’s very good value for money, was £16.99 at the time of writing this review, which I think is very good, as the case feels premium and well made, really soft and comfortable to hold, and I’ve noticed with this version they’ve added a slightly textured surface to the sides, to aid grip, the sides were just smooth on the 14 pro max version I bought 6/7 months ago, so that’s a nice change too. Obviously all the ports are perfectly cut out, and buttons very clicky and responsive. The raised camera bump is generous too, to protect the camera lens when laying the phone down. For me it strikes a good balance of being drop protective, but not too bulky, and without adding too much weight to the phone.Overall I can highly recommended casekoo
Review - Format: Size Name: iPhone 15 Pro MaxColour Name: BlueVerified Purchase
Special feature: anti-slip, scratch resistant, wireless charging compatible, anti-fingerprint, shockproof

Product Title: CASEKOO Armor Shockproof for iPhone 15 Case [10FT Military Grade Protection] Matte Finish Protective Phone Case Anti-Fingerprint Non-Slip Thin Slim Hard Cover for iPhone 15 - Blue
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    "Maximum Protection, Minimal Bulk - CASEKOO Armor Shockproof Delivers!"
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 14 September 2023
Review - Body: I recently acquired an iPhone 15, and my priority was to find a case that could offer superior protection without compromising the phone's sleek design. The CASEKOO Armor Shockproof for iPhone 15 proved to be the perfect choice, striking a balance between robust defense and a slim profile.First and foremost, the matte finish gives it a classy and premium look. The black color adds a touch of sophistication, and it's resistant to fingerprints, so my phone always looks pristine. The slim design doesn't add unnecessary bulk to my iPhone 15, which is something I truly appreciate.The standout feature of this case is its military-grade protection. It's built to withstand a 10-foot drop, providing me with unparalleled peace of mind. The corners have extra reinforcement, which is where most impact occurs during drops. This case can take a hit and protect my iPhone 15 flawlessly.Moreover, the non-slip texture is fantastic. It ensures a secure grip in my hand, preventing accidental drops. The precise cutouts for ports and buttons make it a breeze to access all the features of my iPhone 15. The tactile buttons feel responsive and easy to use.The raised edges around the camera and screen provide an added layer of protection, preventing scratches and dings when I place my phone face-down. This attention to detail shows that CASEKOO has thought of everything.Installation was a breeze, and the slim design makes it easy to slide my iPhone 15 in and out of my pocket without any hassle.In conclusion, the CASEKOO Armor Shockproof for iPhone 15 Case is the ideal combination of style and protection. It offers military-grade defense against drops and accidents while maintaining a sleek and elegant appearance. If you're looking for a case that can handle the toughest situations without sacrificing aesthetics, this is the one. I highly recommend it to anyone with an iPhone 15.
Review - Format: Size Name: iPhone 15Colour Name: BlackVerified Purchase

Product Title: TORRO Leather Case Compatible with iPhone 15 Pro – Premium Leather Wallet Case with Kickstand and Card Slots - Black
Review - Title:
3.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Dissatisfied, comfort issues
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 October 2023
Review - Body: I am dissatisfied with this purchase. Whilst the case seems to be made of decent quality materials, it does not fit iPhone 15 pro well.My biggest complaint is that the phone sits too deep in the case so the case edges stick out too far which makes corner-swipe gestures a lot more difficult to perform. When the phone is held in one hand such swiping becomes even harder.My second complaint is that the new iPhone 15 series side button is barely reachable. My fingers are relatively thin, but I can press the button only using my index finger nail (with some effort!)The third complaint is that the magnetic lock on the side may become an issue because it is quite hard and stick out far enough to cause discomfort, particularly when the phone is held in one hand.As I said in the beginning of this review, I like the materials and design of the case, but the fit issues are annoying.Hopefully, this review will be seen and considered by the manufacturer with a view on improving this product.
Review - Format: Colour Name: Black with Red DetailVerified Purchase

After comparison and further selection, I chose this mobile phone with a strong design. After receiving it, I was shocked by its appearance, solid  The casing has a large memory and is relatively smooth to use. There is no lag at all when browsing the web. The battery capacity is very large. In normal use, even after three days of use, there is still 20% of the remaining power. It is very suitable for me to work outdoors without worrying about power.  and the photos taken by the camera are very clear, which is unexpected. In short, this is a mobile phone that I am satisfied with, and I hope to use it for a long time.

     I was looking for a smartphone, but I have to say that they are quite expensive. I was very pleased to find this one which I find comparable to a name brand phone and even better and someways at a fraction of the cost. This smartphone has a lot of memory up to 256 GB of ROM and 14 GB of RAM. I like that you can also expand it up to 1 TB if you use a TF card. This is a rugged phone. It feels like it has a case on it already because it is very thick and it is IP 68 waterproof as well. It also has dustproof and drop-proof resistance to it to you. This has a 5,000 MAH battery so I can get up to 16 hours of constant use before it needs to be recharged. It even has a cool built-in light in the back with different functions like SOS and adjustable brightness. This phone comes with some built-in apps and it’s very easy to navigate. I like how user-friendly it is as well, and once I hooked up my information in the play store, I can download anything I wanted. Love it!

Product Title: Blackview BV9300 Rugged Smartphone 2023,15080mAh, 21GB+256GB, 100 Lumen Super Bright Flashlight Outdoor Rugged Phone, 6.7''120Hz FHD+ Display, 50MP+32MP Camera, 4G Dual SIM Waterproof Android 12, NFC
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Decent size screen, quick operations
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 27 October 2023
Review - Body: My first impression is that its a substantial phoneOn switching on for the first time one is prompted to select a language . It's easy to change from the default English USA to English UKYou then insert your SIM card(s) or you can skip this and connect to your wi-fi this may take a few minutes to get the phone readyOn completion you are offered the option to copy apps and data from another device. this can copy apps, photos, contacts google accounts etcThis can be done wirelessly if you don't have a double ended cable. You open the Google app on your old device and tap set up new deviceAfter a minute or two one can then choose what to copyAllow a few minutes for thisYou can  choose  between Gestural or button navigation. It's easy to switch back later if you change your mindA search engine can be selected then a PIN, the fingerprint sensor takes a few minutes to set up but it's progress can easily be followednext you can unlock your face this can be set to work with eyes openNext are Vision SettingsDisplay size and text where one can easily adjust the font and display size by means of a sliderthen set the magnification option this enables one to quickly zoom in and out on screen using two fingersThen there is a screen reader for those with visual impairment it reads the screen out loud with the powerful speaker on the rear. To force a restart hold the power button for 10 seconds or soI have dealt with Blackview previously and can confirm they are always to help if necessary

Product Title: Blackview BV9300 Rugged Smartphone 2023,15080mAh, 21GB+256GB, 100 Lumen Super Bright Flashlight Outdoor Rugged Phone, 6.7''120Hz FHD+ Display, 50MP+32MP Camera, 4G Dual SIM Waterproof Android 12, NFC
Review - Title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Excellent phone
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 21 August 2023
Review - Body: I received this on the 13 Aug but only started transferring over three days ago. Yes it's a tank of a phone but for the price, specs & storage, I can't complain. A week's worth of researching, I don't regret buying it,Yes it's heavy but using it for 4 hours on a draining app only used 6% battery, the screen is a fantastic size at 6.70 inch and brilliant colour.I can't afford the slimline ranges at over £1000, just can't/won't justify the purchase, not even the other budget Chinese phones.The UI is friendly after a few niggles as no instructions came with it.Huge 256gb storage & can add 1TB SD card for extra storage 12gb RAM.It's a winner for me.Holding the phone will be my gym workout.No extras come with it, the case is rugged enough to withstand an accident of not Battery life is awesome, a whole day used 10% plus with 33w charging it's full on less than 10mins.Camera leaves much to be desired but got over that using G Cam.Stereo speakers✅6.70 inch screen ✅Battery life 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟UI mostly customisable ⭐⭐⭐⭐This is one serious phone but not for aesthetics.I'm totally in love with this BV9300.Goodbye samsung, Huawei and the rest.Update 23 Aug, sim tray broke, how in the living hell did they design a stupid hinge of all the blasted things, for a sim tray? I'm livid.UPDATE :There's a problem, phone crashed and display greyscale, support informed a motherboard problem.If there's s problem why is this not communicated?

     It's worth saying firstly that these phones are bigger than the average phone so as long as you don't mind a bit of extra bulk on your phone then this device is absolutely brilliant.The BV9300 from Blackview has an amazing spec, very large battery and is housed in a rugged designed case that gives it top end drop protection, dust and waterproof protection. The screen is a 6.7" 120Hz FHD display, it has a 50MP rear camera and 32MP selfie camera, it takes two 4G sim cards and it runs Android 12 which means it has compatibility with almost any application.Spec is great with 21GB of RAM and 256GB of storage. You can expand the storage up to 1TB with a TF card if required, although I doubt I'll need to do so. The battery is 15080mAh which is more than triple the last iPhone capacity and lasts for a long time.These phones are as good as any top end smart phone and a fraction of the price, the only downside is they are bigger, heavier and chunkier.

     The Blackview BV9300 is designed to handle the harshest environments with its robust construction and military-grade durability. Underneath its tough exterior lies a powerful device that doesn't compromise on performance. Equipped with a high-capacity battery, the BV9300 keeps up with your demanding schedule, providing long-lasting power to get you through the day. Its octa-core processor, combined up to 21GB of expandable RAM provides smooth multitasking and seamless performance and the large 256GB of storage is fantastic. The 6.7-inch Full HD+ display offers crisp and vibrant visuals, making your photos, videos, and games come to life. The 50 megapixel camera captures your adventures with superb clarity, especially during the day. Its fingerprint scanner and facial recognition technology offer convenient and secure unlocking options, keeping your data protected while providing quick access to your device

Review - Body: this is my first EVER smartphone (bought because the world has adopted a system that says, if you want to use the net for ANY transaction, you HAVE to have a mobile for verification purposes!! - insane as far as im concerned, but there you go)so i tried to find the best of all features with the best price (quite a search i can tell you)and so far there are more negatives than positives, first of which is the massive LACK of guidance with this thing - literally nothing but the very basic manual to show you the main features and thats it, and for a proper noob like ME, thats an issue!then theres things like facial and thumbprint verification and as far as i can tell, they just arent there (it might be me being stupid or something, but i simply cannot find them on the device)BUT, for a TINY little thing that can sit in your pocket, get access to the net, emails, take stunning photos, allow passcodes and verification purposes for the PRICE it IS, brand NEW, it does kinda work!

Product Title: Apple iPhone 13 Pro Max, 1TB, Sierra Blue (Renewed)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Renewed - not quite in Excellent Condition
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 30 January 2023
Review - Body: Condition:Bought the 13 Max Pro 1TB renewed in Excellent Condition from PixelDirect. Unfortunately there was a small scratch on the screen, and there are plenty of marks on the body. This goes counter to what Excellent Condition should be! I was hoping for much better. Battery was 90% which isn't too bad.Size:It's big but not so big as to make it unusable most of the time. I've quickly gotten used to it from my 6S. It has some heft to it and feels solid.Usage:It's fast and nippy loading apps and moving between them, and the screen is great to look at. The camera take some getting used to, but it's producing good photos so far. It does, however, take ages to charge. The seller enclosed a 10W charger - not great as this will take around six hours for the phone to charge, if I remember correctly. Ok if you charge it overnight. The phone itself can draw around 27W, so buy yourself a 30W charger to get the most out of its fast charge ability and hit 100% in 1.5 hours.

Product Title: Apple iPhone 12 Pro Max, 128GB, Pacific Blue (Renewed)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Seems a good phone so far, but the delivery…
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 5 January 2023
Review - Body: I, like everyone else considering this product, was a bit wary of ordering a renewed phone instead of a new one, without seeing it first anyway. However, upon arrival & first look the phone is in impeccable condition! Everything seems to work as it should and the screen, edges, cameras etc are all free from any signs of use. I do however have two criticisms. The first, is that the battery health is only at 83%. My old iPhone is better than that at around 91/92! Still, it’s a second hand phone and it works. It’s really not the end of the world. It does it’s job and seems fine.My main issue was the delivery. When I heard that the phone was being sent through Evri my heart sank. I’ve lost so many parcels with them lately, this is actually the first parcel I’ve ever had arrive in one piece from them. The parcel was lost, then turned up again, then lost again, delayed, and finally arrived a week after it was due and then thrown over my 6ft garden fence. Luckily however, the phone is in one piece. I would just urge the seller to reconsider who they are using to send these devices.I would gladly buy another device from this company when the time comes, but not if Evri are taking anything to do with it.

Product Title: Apple iPhone 12 Pro Max, 128GB, Pacific Blue (Renewed)
Review - Title:
4.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Very impressed but...
Review - Date: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 12 February 2023
Review - Body: I am very pleased with the appearance of my new phone. Despite buying a refurbished device, it arrived without any noticeable dents or scratches on the screen. There were some small scuffs on the stainless steel band, but they were not too noticeable and did not cause any discomfort during use. I was impressed with the overall condition of the phone, indicating that the previous owner took good care of it. Upon testing all of its features, I found that they were all in good working order. However, I was a bit disappointed with the battery life. The battery health was only 84%, which is lower than I expected. Upon further investigation, I found that the phone had lost over 800mAh of its battery capacity and had gone through over 700 charge cycles. Given these factors, I would have preferred if the battery was replaced. Despite this, I am happy with the functioning of all the other features of the phone.
